page.title: 07EMPLOYMENT IN OAKLEY AREA
page.content: Oakley,Comrie and Blairhall are dormitory villages with little work within the immediate area bar local shops,pubs,farms and clubs. Our survey was done of the working population aged mainly between{20 and {40. Most people travel to work within a 20 mile radius in local businesses, no-one worked outside Scotland save a few who work on the oil rigs or in the Royal Navy. The main employers are{The National {Coal Board}who employ 23% despite the recent miners'dispute and its subsequent redundancies.{Rosyth {Dockyard}employ 7%. 22% of mothers work and most of these are at part-time occupations. {18% of the local population is {unemployed}which is slightly higher than the national average.
